key_points: Joe Biden will be sworn in as United States president in a ceremony that emphasizes a new beginning and unity.
Kamala Harris will become the country's first female, Black, and South Asian vice president.
The inauguration will showcase diversity and youth, aiming to restore the soul of America.
Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor will swear in Kamala Harris, marking a historic moment as both are 'firsts' in their fields.
Kamala Harris will use two Bibles for her swearing-in, one owned by Regina Shelton and another by Thurgood Marshall, symbolizing significant personal and historical influences.
Reverend Leo O'Donovan, a longtime friend of the Biden family, will deliver the invocation prayer.
Andrea Hall, the first Black woman to be promoted to Fire Captain in Fulton County, Georgia, will lead the Pledge of Allegiance.
Amanda Gorman, the United States' first national youth poet laureate, will deliver a poetry reading.
Pastor Silvester Beaman from Wilmington, Delaware, will deliver the benediction, highlighting his close relationship with the Biden family.
The ceremony will also feature attendance from former US presidents, members of Congress, celebrities, and other notable guests.
spokespersons: Silvester Beaman (Pastor, Bethel African Methodist Episcopal Church, Wilmington, Delaware)
